title: Sleep
summary:
Key ideas
- The author notes that the human mind is endlessly fascinating
- The author's mind arbitrarily separates attempts at falling asleep into "sleep mode" and "nap mode"
- The author has difficulty with maintaining a normal sleep schedule due to their mind's separation of sleep attempts

Key learnings
- The author experiences a pleasant tightness in their abdomen after waking up from "nap mode"
- Melatonin shifts the author further into "nap mode"

Key questions
- Has anyone else had a similar experience with their mind arbitrarily separating attempts at falling asleep?
- Has anyone else been able to solve this issue of not being able to maintain a normal sleep schedule?
